1607868478_1MUqNCPTZnz9R3c39yWSQesf3gwbC.body: Covid exists, but it has been effectively used to gain authoritarian power across the globe. The virus itself isn't a scam, the response to it absolutely is. It has exposed how many people go along with literal retardation (mask mandates outside with no one even remotely nearby) just because the government tells them to do so. Telling us that we can control viruses is also a scam, all over the globe we see that the measures short of total police state lockdown at best postpone the problem (and even then I do not believe you can actually achieve 0 cases, seems ridiculous and false numbers seem to be a better explanation).

> the goal isn't to reach 0 cases its to slow down the spread as a cure or vaccine can be developed and distributed
I've seen people advocate for total lockdowns to be covid free. I am talking in response to those people. If you are in favour of "slow down the spread", please present a concrete end condition and maximum damage you are willing to inflict on things like the economy or social relationships to achieve it. As far as I am concerned, we're far past the point of the cure being worse than the disease, with countries going authoritarian which will take years of time and blood to undo, small businesses closed permanently, people thrown into paranoia about simply meeting their family.

> governments aren't saying that masks and lockdowns prevent the spread health and scientific authorities are.
I am fairly certain the WHO's current position is that lockdowns are not effective, and yet governments keep doing them anyway - you will get different opinions from different authorities. Mask mandates and lockdowns are not just a medical question, because health is not the only issue in society, and especially lockdowns affect far more than just health. I am against both being forced onto people on principle. If you feel scared and want to close your business or you don't want to go to shops and would rather buy online, it is your choice and I respect it. Let me make mine.

Hell, I would've even been okay with a lockdown at the start of the whole ordeal, as long as the rules would be clear, exit conditions specified and taxes suspended. As it stands today, it has been government overreach after overreach, confusing rules, incredible waste of public money and a lot of unlawful rules being enforced anyway. I understand health concerns, but I ask the other side of the issue to consider my position too.

> their current stance is that they're effective just not as a primary strategy to halt spread.
fair enough, I accept.

> I'm ok with measures like that being forced as long as they're temporary and reasonable
I could compromise on temporary lockdowns, as I said. We're on month 8 or more, depending on where you are, and there is no end in sight, with deadlines being pushed further over and over again. I would love to get an answer to 
> please present a concrete end condition and maximum damage you are willing to inflict on things like the economy or social relationships to achieve it
I've never seen conditions put forward, it's always either lock down for as long as "the experts" tell us to, or from the other side "never close anything".

Instead of respecting people as responsible adults through transparency - by setting predictable, clear rules and concrete declarations, instead of saying "we're sorry, we need to do this for this time for this reason", we've been treated to confusing messaging, constantly shifting standards, endless bait and switches of "we'll allow you to open in a month" changing to "sorry, you can't open" after people already invested their money. On top of that, time and time again the politicians and media personalities were caught breaking the rules they set or promoted, with little to no consequence for doing so.

We also have not seen any public debate weighing the pros and cons of the preventative measures taken. Lockdowns lead to higher suicide and abuse rates, deteriorating mental health, destruction of small businesses, not to mention economical damage and further debt. Those are all matters of human life, lockdowns do not happen in a vacuum and while potentially delaying covid, they have adverse effects that were never discussed properly. Again, I would love transparency, with politicians coming out to say "we can handle this much economic damage", "we have to do this even though there will be those consequences", but we had none of that, instead, lockdowns were presented as a moral good and objectors called morons, censored or deplatformed.

Definitely went on a bit of a rant here, this has been boiling in me for a very long time. I think there was a way to get through this peacefully while maintaining trust, and I think the way this was handled was an absolute disgrace. At this point, I want either transparency and clear exit conditions, or immediate end of all lockdowns, I very much am done with my government locking me in my house with the reason being "just trust me bro". I am aware neither will happen, unfortunately.

> [goodusername](#comment_9_112NAM5jhYWH4egafracJEF92oyeUY3F3T): I don't know about yours but in my country they're are public debates about the pros and cons of preventative measures. [...]
Thanks a lot for the conversation, I'm very glad to talk to someone reasonable after feeling like the world is going insane for a long time. I suppose it comes down to country differences, I envy your situation and would definitely have far less of a problem with lockdowns had it been the same here.

1610228061_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
Transparency is the key. I am generally against lockdowns and mask mandates on principle, but I can agree to restrictions if there are clear rules, there is a solid deadline and a maximum shift for that deadline, and I am informed about government decisions and the reasoning behind them. As it stands now, I have no more trust for the government nor media in my country, because the rules are constantly changing, there are no deadlines I can trust and many rules are flat out nonsensical.

Mask wearing is also a similar issue, if I am to be honest, I have to say wearing one disgusts me after "wear your mask" essentially became a cult that you are not allowed to question. We still have a mandate forcing us to wear masks outside regardless of circumstances, which is utter nonsense, and it is not the first nor the only nonsensical rule. There isn't any concern for disposal, nobody cares about what you use as long as it covers your face, making the whole ordeal look like an exercise in compliance over actual protection.

Again, I would accept it with transparency, like stated before, but at the moment we're not being treated as adults, instead of "we're sorry, but for reason X we need to do Y for Z amount of time", we're getting "shut up and comply".  I'd imagine (and have already been told by someone here) that if your government is more respectful, you'd have a different attitude.

As for compensation, it is only fair that the government suspends as many taxes as possible for the time of the lockdown, because if you are not allowed to earn money, you should not be forced to pay what you have saved. I'm mixed on stimulus, especially if the money for it is to be borrowed or printed and the amount is pitiful compared to months of expenses.

If you have a full lockdown and you manage to eradicate covid on your island, that's great. Is the plan to vaccinate as many people as possible and only then open the borders back up? I'd imagine you'd risk another outbreak if you started allowing flights again, even with testing.
